learned: Through this project, I learned how to build and connect a full-stack application using React, React Native, Node.js, Express, and MongoDB. I gained hands-on experience structuring backend APIs, handling clientâ€“server communication with Axios, and managing data flow between the frontend and database. I also improved my understanding of component-based architecture, asynchronous operations, and error handling, while using Tailwind CSS, DaisyUI, and Lucide React to create a consistent and user-friendly interface. Overall, the project helped me understand how real-world applications are designed, built, and debugged across both frontend and backend layers.

title: Swamped
goal: A mobile task manager app that saves user data locally using asynchronous functions to ensure data is stored persistently without slowing down the app.
learned: I learned how to build a mobile task manager app that smoothly saves and retrieves user data locally by leveraging asynchronous functions, ensuring the app stays responsive and data persists across sessions without relying on the internet.

title: Wallet-app
goal: A mobile app that securely authenticates users and integrates with databases to accurately track, save, and manage their expenses and income, providing a dynamic, real-time dashboard that visually displays financial insights and helps users make smarter money decisions.
learned: I learned how to build a mobile finance app that securely authenticates users and uses a robust backend database like PostgreSQL to store and manage detailed expense and income data.
